#Text=Chuqui Huipa
#Text=The Coya Chuqui Huipa ( floruit 1532 ) , was a princess and queen consort , Coya , of the Inca Empire by marriage to her brother , the Sapa Inca Huáscar ( r 1527-1532 ) .
#Text=Early life
#Text=Chuqui Huipa was the daughter of the Inca Huayna Capac and Rahua Ocllo , and thus the full sister of Huáscar .
#Text=At the time of her father 's death in 1527 , she , her mother and his entire harem , was in Quito with him .

#Text=Her father had willed his throne to his illegitimate son , her half brother Atahualpa , but her legitimate full brother Huáscar had the will overturned , executed his fathers ’ executors , and claimed the throne for himself .

#Text=He then ordered for his mother , sister and the rest of the harem to be brought to Cuzco , as he wished to follow the ancient custom to marry his sister , to even more ensure that his own blood line would be completely legitimate . [ 1 ]
#Text=Marriage
#Text=The wedding was performed with some difficulty .
#Text=Her mother had initially refused to give her consent to it , which was crucial for it to take place .
#Text=Her reason is reported to have been personal discontent with Huáscar , and disapproval of his execution of her late husband 's executors .
#Text=She is reported to have favored the illegitimate son of her spouse , Atahualpa , who had been brought up in her household , before Huáscar .
#Text=As the wedding was important for the succession to continue undisturbed , this presented a problem for Huáscar .
#Text=Her mother was finally forced to consent , and the wedding and coronation could take place . [ 1 ]
#Text=Queen
#Text=The relationship between queen Chuqui Huipa and Huáscar was reportedly not a happy one .
#Text=Huáscar viewed his brother Atahualpa as a threat and had many people at court executed because he believed their loyalty to be faltering .
#Text=Atahualpa , who resided in a different part of the realm , had been absent from the coronation of Huáscar .
#Text=He did , however , send his loyalists and spokespersons with gifts and greetings to the queen and her mother in Cuzco , who received them kindly .
#Text=This exposed them both to suspicions from Huáscar , who assumed them to belong to the opposition and of taking sides with Atahualpa against him .

#Text=As soon as the visitors left , Huáscar caused a scene by entering the queen 's audience chamber and accusing the queen 's mother of being the prime adviser of Atahualpa , and them both of disloyalty .
#Text=Both the queen and her mother denied the accusations , and Huáscar was not able to prove anything against them .
#Text=He did , however , had them placed under guard and spies placed around them to report of their every act .
#Text=The queen reacted very badly to be placed under such circumstances .

#Text=Reportedly , she took such offence of being put under watch , that she refrained from eating during day time and only took one meal during the night , to ensure that the spies would have nothing to report , not even such innocent activities such as eating .
#Text=Her new conditions also caused a depression , and she reportedly took to abuse coca , both to sleep at night but also during day time .
#Text=The bad relationship between the royal couple was noticed and attracted public attention and bad publicity .
#Text=When Huáscar had several members of the embassy Atahualpa had sent to him in Quito executed , the remaining member of his embassy , Quilaco , appealed to the queen and her mother for help .
#Text=When the civil war erupted between the two brothers , the situation for the queen and her mother became even more difficult .
#Text=When Atahualpa escaped from his brothers custody , they were both , reportedly , very close to being arrested and executed .
#Text=In 1532 , Huáscar was defeated and taken prisoner by the army of Atahualpa , who paraded him in public as a prisoner to the capital of Cuzco after the Battle of Quipaipan .
#Text=Upon entering the city , the loyalists of Atahualpa reportedly called Rahua Ocllo a concubine rather than a queen in order to present Huáscar as illegitimate .
#Text=Despite this , Rahua Ocllo approached her captive and deposed son by reproaching him in public .

#Text=She explained that though he was her son , he deserved his present predicament because of his execution of Atahualpa 's ambassadors , for all his misdeeds , and for having dragged down his entire family including her in his ruin without cause , and slapped him in public . [ 1 ]
